BREAKTROUGH:
Psychospore: R<>G
ACTION: Exhaust this card to remove a command token from a system that contains 1 or more of your infantry and return it to your reinforcements. Then, place 1 infantry in that system.

Component_ID: Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.
Full_Rule_Text: Your space docks cannot produce infantry. At the start of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

Component_ID: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.
Full_Rule_Text: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 6 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Component_ID: At the end of the status phase, you may remove any number of infantry from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of the status phase, you may remove any number of infantry from planets you control and place them on 1 or more planets you control in the same or adjacent systems.

Component_ID: After you activate this system, you may produce up to 5 units in this system.
Full_Rule_Text: After you activate this system, you may produce up to 5 units in this system.
DEPLOY: When you would use your Mitosis faction ability, you may replace 1 of your infantry with 1 mech from your reinforcements instead.
ACTION: Exhaust this card and choose a player's non-fighter ship; that player may replace that ship with one from their reinforcements that costs up to 2 more than the replaced ship.
Unlock: Have 12 ground forces on planets you control.

Component_ID: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your units that have PRODUCTION
Full_Rule_Text: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your units that have PRODUCTION

Component_ID: You may produce 1 unit in that system.
Full_Rule_Text: You may produce 1 unit in that system.
ACTION: Produce any number of units in any number of systems that contain 1 or more of your ground forces.

Component_ID: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units
Full_Rule_Text: After another player moves ships into a system that contains 1 or more of your units:

Component_ID: You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.
Full_Rule_Text: You may place 1 command token from that player's reinforcements in any non-home system.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Arborec player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Arborec player.

STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES:
Choose two of the following:
Neural Motivator (0)
Sarween Tools (0)
Plasma Scoring (0)

Component_ID: You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game, including you.
Full_Rule_Text: You always vote first during the agenda phase. When you cast at least 1 vote, cast 1 additional vote for each player in the game, including you.

Component_ID: When 1 or more of your units use ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, for each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has Sustain Damage to become damaged.
Full_Rule_Text: When 1 or more of your units use ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, for each hit produced in excess of your opponent's fighters, choose 1 of your opponent's ships that has Sustain Damage to become damaged.

Component_ID: When this unit uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, each result of 9 or 10 also destroys 1 of your opponent's infantry in the space area of the active system.
Full_Rule_Text: When this unit uses ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, each result of 9 or 10 also destroys 1 of your opponent's infantry in the space area of the active system.

Component_ID: Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.
Full_Rule_Text: Other players cannot move ships through systems that contain your structures.

Component_ID: Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION
Full_Rule_Text: Each planet that contains 1 or more of your structures gains the PRODUCTION: 1 ability as if it were a unit.

Component_ID: Other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships in this system.
Full_Rule_Text: Other players cannot use SPACE CANNON against your ships in this system.

Component_ID: This unit does not count against capacity if it is being transported or if it is in a space area with 1 or more of your ships that have capacity values.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit does not count against capacity if it is being transported or if it is in a space area with 1 or more of your ships that have capacity values.

Component_ID: When a player produces ground forces in a system
Full_Rule_Text: When a player produces ground forces in a system:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card; that player may place those units on any planets they control in that system and any adjacent systems.
Unlock: Have 6 units that have ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE, SPACE CANNON, or BOMBARDMENT on the game board.

Component_ID: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability
Full_Rule_Text: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:

Component_ID: You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.
Full_Rule_Text: You may choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.
ACTION: Move any number of your ships from any systems to any number of other systems that contain 1 of your command tokens and no other players' ships. Then, purge this card.

Component_ID: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability
Full_Rule_Text: When 1 or more of your units make a roll for a unit ability:

Component_ID: Choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.
Full_Rule_Text: Choose 1 of those units to roll 1 additional die.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Argent player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Argent player.

Component_ID: When you activate a system that contains only your units, you may place command tokens from your reinforcements into any systems adjacent to that system that contain only your units; at the end of this action, you may move ships among the active system and systems adjacent to it that contain your command tokens.
Full_Rule_Text: When you activate a system that contains only your units, you may place command tokens from your reinforcements into any systems adjacent to that system that contain only your units; at the end of this action, you may move ships among the active system and systems adjacent to it that contain your command tokens.

Component_ID: At the start of each round of space combat, you may spend 2 trade goods; you may reroll any number of your dice during that combat round.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of each round of space combat, you may spend 2 trade goods; you may reroll any number of your dice during that combat round.

Component_ID: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.
Full_Rule_Text: The maximum number of non-fighter ships you can have in each system is equal to 2 more than the number of tokens in your fleet pool.

Component_ID: After you and your opponent roll dice during space combat
Full_Rule_Text: After you and your opponent roll dice during space combat:

Component_ID: You may reroll all of your opponent's dice.
Full_Rule_Text: You may reroll all of your opponent's dice.

Component_ID: You may reroll any number of your dice.
Full_Rule_Text: You may reroll any number of your dice.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Letnev player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Letnev player.

Component_ID: At the start of the status phase, you may replace one of your non-unit upgrade technologies with a technology of the same color that has exactly 1 more prerequisite.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of the status phase, you may replace one of your non-unit upgrade technologies with a technology of the same color that has exactly 1 more prerequisite.

Component_ID: At the start of the status phase, gain 1 trade good for each ocean card in play.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of the status phase, gain 1 trade good for each ocean card in play.

Component_ID: This ship can move through systems that contain your units, even if other players' units are present; if it would, apply +1 to its move value for each of those systems.
Full_Rule_Text: This ship can move through systems that contain your units, even if other players' units are present; if it would, apply +1 to its move value for each of those systems.

Component_ID: When another player activates this system, if this unit is coexisting, you may move it and any of your infantry on its planet to a planet you control in your home system.
Full_Rule_Text: When another player activates this system, if this unit is coexisting, you may move it and any of your infantry on its planet to a planet you control in your home system.

Component_ID: When another player researches a technology
Full_Rule_Text: When another player researches a technology: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to ignore 1 prerequisite; if they do, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements into coexistence on a non-home planet they control.
Unlock: Have an ocean card in play.

Component_ID: When another player spends resources to research a technology
Full_Rule_Text: When another player spends resources to research a technology: That player may reduce the cost by 1; if they do, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

ACTION: Purge this card and a non-unit upgrade technology you own or from your deck; then, purge all cards with the same name owned by other players and in other players' decks. Then, each player that purged a technology they owned researches another technology.

ACTION: Exhaust this card to allow each other player to spend 3 trade goods and give you 1 promissory note. Each player that does may research a non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology. You also gain each technology researched in this way.

Component_ID: After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.
Full_Rule_Text: After you gain control of a planet, gain 1 trade good.

Component_ID: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.
Full_Rule_Text: You can score objectives even if you do not control the planets in your home system.

Component_ID: Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.
Full_Rule_Text: Other players cannot activate asteroid fields that contain 1 or more of your ships.

Component_ID: At the start of your turn during the action phase, you may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of your turn during the action phase, you may produce 1 unit in a system that contains at least 1 of your units that has PRODUCTION.

Component_ID: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.

Component_ID: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit is placed in a space area instead of on a planet. This unit can move and retreat as if it were a ship. If this unit is blockaded, it is destroyed.
DEPLOY: After you gain control of a planet, you may spend 1 trade good to place 1 mech on that planet.

Component_ID: After a player activates a system
Full_Rule_Text: After a player activates a system:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to increase the move value of 1 of that player's ships to match the move value of the ship on the game board that has the highest move value.
Unlock: Have 3 space docks on the game board.

Component_ID: When you produce fighters or infantry
Full_Rule_Text: When you produce fighters or infantry:

Component_ID: You may place each of those units at any of your space docks that are not blockaded.
Full_Rule_Text: You may place each of those units at any of your space docks that are not blockaded.
ACTION: Choose 1 system that is adjacent to 1 of your space docks. Destroy all other players' infantry and fighters in that system.

Component_ID: After you commit 1 or more units to land on a planet
Full_Rule_Text: After you commit 1 or more units to land on a planet:

Component_ID: Remove all of the Saar player's ground forces from that planet and place them on a planet controlled by the Saar player. Then, return this card to the Saar player.
Full_Rule_Text: Remove all of the Saar player's ground forces from that planet and place them on a planet controlled by the Saar player. Then, return this card to the Saar player.

ACTION: Exhaust this card and spend any amount of resources to choose a planet up to 2 systems away from an asteroid field that contains your ships; roll a number of dice equal to the amount spent and assign 1 hit to a ground force on that planet for each roll of 4 or greater.

HOME_SYSTEM:
Argent Flight:
Avar: 1/1
Valk: 2/0
Ylir: 0/2
Mentak Coalition:
Mol Primus: 4/1
Xxcha Kingdom:
Archon Ren: 2/3
Archon Tau: 1/1
Keleres - Legendary
Custodia Vigilia: 2/3
While you control Mecatol Rex, it gains SPACE CANNON 5 and PRODUCTION 3.
Gain 2 command tokens when another player scores VP using Imperial.
STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES: Choose 2 non-faction technologies owned by other players

Component_ID: During setup, choose an unplayed faction from among the Mentak, the Xxcha, and the Argent Flight; take that faction's home system, command tokens, and control markers. Additionally, take the Keleres hero that corresponds to that faction.
Full_Rule_Text: During setup, choose an unplayed faction from among the Mentak, the Xxcha, and the Argent Flight; take that faction's home system, command tokens, and control markers. Additionally, take the Keleres hero that corresponds to that faction.

Component_ID: Replenish your commodities at the start of the strategy phase, then gain 1 trade good.
Full_Rule_Text: Replenish your commodities at the start of the strategy phase, then gain 1 trade good.

Component_ID: You may spend 1 Trade Good or Commodity to treat all laws as blank until the end of the turn.
Full_Rule_Text: You may spend 1 Trade Good or Commodity to treat all laws as blank until the end of the turn.

Component_ID: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 action card and gain 2 trade goods.
Full_Rule_Text: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 1 action card and gain 2 trade goods.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Keleres player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Keleres player.
ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place either 2 fighters or 1 destroyer from your reinforcements in a system that contains 1 or more of your war suns.

Component_ID: Your ships can move through supernovas.
Full_Rule_Text: Your ships can move through supernovas.

Component_ID: Other players units in this system lose the Planetary Shield ability.
Full_Rule_Text: Other players units in this system lose the Planetary Shield ability.

Component_ID: Your ships can move into supernovas.
Full_Rule_Text: Your ships can move into supernovas.

Component_ID: Each supernova that contains 1 or more of your units gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were 1 of your units.
Full_Rule_Text: Each supernova that contains 1 or more of your units gains the PRODUCTION 5 ability as if it were 1 of your units.

Component_ID: Other players units in this system lose the Planetary Shield ability.
Full_Rule_Text: Other players units in this system lose the Planetary Shield ability.
ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 1 cruiser in this unit's system.

Component_ID: When you use your Star Forge faction ability in this system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with this unit.
Full_Rule_Text: When you use your Star Forge faction ability in this system or an adjacent system, you may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements with this unit.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose a player; that player may produce up to 2 units that each have a cost of 4 or less in a system that contains one of their war suns or their flagship.

Component_ID: After you spend a token from your strategy pool
Full_Rule_Text: After you spend a token from your strategy pool:

Component_ID: After you move a war sun into a non-home system other than Mecatol Rex
Full_Rule_Text: After you move a war sun into a non-home system other than Mecatol Rex:

Component_ID: You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.
Full_Rule_Text: You may destroy all other players' units in that system and replace that system tile with the Muaat supernova tile. If you do, purge this card and each planet card that corresponds to the replaced system tile.
ACTION: Remove 1 token from the Muaat player's fleet pool and return it to his reinforcements. Then, gain your war sun unit upgrade technology card.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Muaat Player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Muaat Player.

Component_ID: When you gain this card, place the Avernus planet token into a non-home system that is adjacent to a planet you control; gain control of and ready it.
Full_Rule_Text: When you gain this card, place the Avernus planet token into a non-home system that is adjacent to a planet you control; gain control of and ready it.

Component_ID: After you move 1 of your war suns out of or through Avernus's system and into a non-home system, you may move the Avernus token with it.
Full_Rule_Text: After you move 1 of your war suns out of or through Avernus's system and into a non-home system, you may move the Avernus token with it.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to use the Embers of Muaat's STAR FORGE faction ability without spending a command token.

Component_ID: You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the Trade strategy card.
Full_Rule_Text: You do not have to spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the Trade strategy card.

Component_ID: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
Full_Rule_Text: You can negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

Component_ID: When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.
Full_Rule_Text: When you are negotiating a transaction, action cards can be exchanged as part of that transaction.
ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area.

Component_ID: While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.
Full_Rule_Text: While this card is in your play area, you may negotiate transactions with players who are not your neighbor.

Component_ID: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.
Full_Rule_Text: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Hacan player's units, return this card to the Hacan player.

Component_ID: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.
Full_Rule_Text: Nebulae do not affect your ships' movement.

Component_ID: After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through system that contain your ships.
Full_Rule_Text: After a player activates a system, you may allow that player to move their ships through system that contain your ships.

Component_ID: During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes.
Full_Rule_Text: During setup, take the additional Empyrean faction promissory note; you have 2 faction promissory notes.
ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area.

Component_ID: When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.
Full_Rule_Text: When you and the Empyrean player cast votes for the same outcome, cast 4 additional votes for that outcome.

Component_ID: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.
Full_Rule_Text: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.
ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area.

Component_ID: When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.
Full_Rule_Text: When you give a number of commodities to the Empyrean player equal to your maximum commodity value, you each gain 1 trade good.

Component_ID: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.
Full_Rule_Text: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Empyrean player's units, return this card to the Empyrean player.
ACTION: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on 1 planet you control.

Component_ID: When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.
Full_Rule_Text: When you gain command tokens during the status phase, gain 1 additional command token.

Component_ID: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.
Full_Rule_Text: After this unit is destroyed, roll 1 die. If the result is 5 or greater, place the unit on this card. At the start of your next turn, place each unit that is on this card on a planet you control in your home system.

Component_ID: At the end of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements in this system's space area.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of the status phase, place 1 infantry from your reinforcements in this system's space area.
DEPLOY: After you use your Orbital Drop faction ability, you may spend 3 resources to place 1 mech on that planet.

Component_ID: At the start of a ground combat round
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a ground combat round:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to choose 1 ground force in the active system; that ground force rolls 1 additional die during this combat round.
Unlock: Control planets that have a combined total of at least 12 resources.

Component_ID: At the start of a ground combat on a planet you control
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a ground combat on a planet you control:

Component_ID: You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
Full_Rule_Text: You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on that planet.
ACTION: Remove each of your command tokens from the game board and return them to your reinforcements. Then, purge this card.

Component_ID: At the start of the Sol player's turn
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of the Sol player's turn:

Component_ID: Remove 1 token from the Sol player's strategy pool, if able, and return it to his reinforcements. Then, you may place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.
Full_Rule_Text: Remove 1 token from the Sol player's strategy pool, if able, and return it to his reinforcements. Then, you may place 2 infantry from your reinforcements on any planet you control.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Sol player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Sol player.

Component_ID: When you produce a ship that has capacity, you may also produce any combination of ground forces or fighters up to that ship's capacity; they do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.
Full_Rule_Text: When you produce a ship that has capacity, you may also produce any combination of ground forces or fighters up to that ship's capacity; they do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.

Component_ID: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or a beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.
Full_Rule_Text: You treat all systems that contain either an alpha or a beta wormhole as adjacent to each other. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

Component_ID: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.
Full_Rule_Text: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains either an alpha or beta wormhole.

Component_ID: When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate
Full_Rule_Text: When you create the game board, place the Creuss Gate (tile 17) where your home system would normally be placed. The Creuss Gate system is not a home system. Then place your home system (tile 51) in your play area.

Component_ID: At the start of your turn during the action phase
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of your turn during the action phase:

Component_ID: Place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.
Full_Rule_Text: Place or move a Creuss wormhole token into either a system that contains a planet you control or a non-home system that does not contain another player's ships.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Creuss player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Creuss player.

Component_ID: When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: When you gain control of a planet, replace each PDS and space dock that is on that planet with a matching unit from your reinforcements.

Component_ID: After each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.
Full_Rule_Text: After each round of ground combat, your ships in the active system may use their BOMBARDMENT abilities against your opponent's ground forces on the planet.

Component_ID: This unit cannot be destroyed by Direct Hit action cards.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit cannot be destroyed by Direct Hit action cards.

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card and spend 2 resources when you research a technology; ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card and spend 2 resources when you research a technology; ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.

Component_ID: During a space combat, hits produced by this ship and by your dreadnoughts in this system must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.
Full_Rule_Text: During a space combat, hits produced by this ship and by your dreadnoughts in this system must be assigned to non-fighter ships if able.

Component_ID: While not participating in ground combat, this unit can use its BOMBARDMENT ability on planets in its system as if it were a ship.
Full_Rule_Text: While not participating in ground combat, this unit can use its BOMBARDMENT ability on planets in its system as if it were a ship.

Component_ID: After a player activates a system
Full_Rule_Text: After a player activates a system:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to replace 1 of their infantry in the active system with 1 mech from their reinforcements.
Unlock: Have 4 dreadnoughts on the game board.

Component_ID: Units that have Planetary Shield do not prevent you from using BOMBARDMENT.
Full_Rule_Text: Units that have Planetary Shield do not prevent you from using BOMBARDMENT.
ACTION: Choose 1 system that does not contain other players' ships; you may move your flagship and any number of your dreadnoughts from other systems into the chosen system. Then, purge this card.

Component_ID: When you gain command tokens during the status phase
Full_Rule_Text: When you gain command tokens during the status phase:

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the L1Z1X player.

Component_ID: When you gain control of a planet, place infantry from your reinforcements equal to that planet's influence value on that planet
Full_Rule_Text: When you gain control of a planet, place infantry from your reinforcements equal to that planet's influence value on that planet

Component_ID: When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens; other players' tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.
Full_Rule_Text: When you win a combat, place 1 command token from your opponent's reinforcements in your fleet pool if it does not already contain 1 of that player's tokens; other players' tokens in your fleet pool increase your fleet limit but cannot be redistributed.

Component_ID: While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it's unlocked.
Full_Rule_Text: While another player's command token is in your fleet pool, you can use the ability of that player's commander, if it's unlocked.

Component_ID: During setup, purge your Alliance promissory note. Other players cannot give you their Alliance promissory notes.
Full_Rule_Text: During setup, purge your Alliance promissory note. Other players cannot give you their Alliance promissory notes.

Component_ID: After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.
Full_Rule_Text: After this unit is destroyed, gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.

Component_ID: At the start of the strategy phase
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of the strategy phase:

Component_ID: Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact player's command sheet places a token from their reinforcements in that system. Then, return this card to the Mahact player.
Full_Rule_Text: Choose 1 non-home system that contains your units; each other player who has a token on the Mahact player's command sheet places a token from their reinforcements in that system. Then, return this card to the Mahact player.

Component_ID: During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.
Full_Rule_Text: During combat against an opponent whose command token is not in your fleet pool, apply +2 to the results of this unit's combat rolls.

Component_ID: After a player whose command token is in your fleet pool activates this system, you may spend their token from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.
Full_Rule_Text: After a player whose command token is in your fleet pool activates this system, you may spend their token from your fleet pool to end their turn; they gain that token.

Component_ID: When you would spend a command token during the secondary ability of a strategic
Full_Rule_Text: When you would spend a command token during the secondary ability of a strategic
ACTION: You may exhaust this card to remove 1 of the active player's command tokens from the board and use it instead.
Unlock: Have 2 other factions' command tokens in your fleet pool.

Component_ID: During your tactical actions, you can activate systems that contain your command tokens. If you do, return both command tokens to your reinforcements and end your turn.
Full_Rule_Text: During your tactical actions, you can activate systems that contain your command tokens. If you do, return both command tokens to your reinforcements and end your turn.

ACTION: Move all units in the space area of any system to an adjacent system that contains a different player's ships. Space combat is resolved in that system; neither player can retreat or resolve abilities that would move their ships. Then, purge this card.
ACTION: Exhaust this card and purge 1 of your technologies to gain 1 relic.

Component_ID: At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of his ships.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a space combat, you may roll 1 die for each of up to 2 of your cruisers or destroyers in the system. For each result equal to or greater than that ship's combat value produce 1 hit; your opponent must assign it to 1 of his ships.

Component_ID: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if he has 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of his trade goods or commodities.
Full_Rule_Text: After 1 of your neighbors gains trade goods or resolves a transaction, if he has 3 or more trade goods, you may take 1 of his trade goods or commodities.
ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area.

Component_ID: While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use his Pillage faction ability against you.
Full_Rule_Text: While this card is in your play area, the Mentak player cannot use his Pillage faction ability against you.

Component_ID: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.
Full_Rule_Text: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Mentak player's units, return this card to the Mentak player.

Component_ID: At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu 0 token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of the strategy phase, place the Naalu 0 token on your strategy card; you are first in initiative order.

Component_ID: After another player moves ships into a system that contains one or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.
Full_Rule_Text: After another player moves ships into a system that contains one or more of your ships, you may place 1 token from your strategy pool in an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; move your ships from the active system into that system.

Component_ID: This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as 1/2 of a ship against your fleet pool.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit may move without being transported. Each fighter in excess of your ships' capacity counts as 1/2 of a ship against your fleet pool.

Component_ID: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, that player removes 1 token from his fleet pool and returns it to his reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: After another player activates a system that contains 1 or more of your ships, that player removes 1 token from his fleet pool and returns it to his reinforcements.

Component_ID: During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.
Full_Rule_Text: During an invasion in this system, you may commit fighters to planets as if they were ground forces. When combat ends, return those units to the space area.
DEPLOY: When another player gains a relic, place 1 mech on any planet you control

Component_ID: After any player's command token is placed in a system
Full_Rule_Text: After any player's command token is placed in a system:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to return that token to that player's reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to return that token to that player's reinforcements.
Unlock: Have ground forces in or adjacent to the Mecatol Rex system.

Component_ID: You may look at your neighbors' hands of promissory notes and the top and bottom card of the agenda deck.
Full_Rule_Text: You may look at your neighbors' hands of promissory notes and the top and bottom card of the agenda deck.

Component_ID: At the end of the status phase
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of the status phase:

Component_ID: You may force each other player to give you 1 promissory note from their hand. If you do, purge this card.
Full_Rule_Text: You may force each other player to give you 1 promissory note from their hand. If you do, purge this card.

Component_ID: At the end of the Strategy Phase
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of the Strategy Phase:

Component_ID: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the Naalu 0 token on your strategy card; you are the first in initiative order. The Naalu player cannot use his Telepathic faction ability during this game round.
Full_Rule_Text: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the Naalu 0 token on your strategy card; you are the first in initiative order. The Naalu player cannot use his Telepathic faction ability during this game round.

Component_ID: Return this card to the Naalu player at the end of the status phase.
Full_Rule_Text: Return this card to the Naalu player at the end of the status phase.

Component_ID: When you would resolve the secondary ability of another player's strategy card, you may give them a promissory note to resolve it without spending a command token.
Full_Rule_Text: When you would resolve the secondary ability of another player's strategy card, you may give them a promissory note to resolve it without spending a command token.

Component_ID: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.
Full_Rule_Text: When you explore a planet that contains 1 of your mechs, you may draw 1 additional card; choose 1 to resolve and discard the rest.
ACTION: Either purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic or purge 1 of your relic fragments to gain 1 command token.
ACTION: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of the same type to gain 1 relic.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Naaz-Rokha player.

STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES:
2 Carriers
1 Destroyer
2 Fighters
1 Mech
3 Infantry
1 Space Dock

Component_ID: After you explore a planet, ready that planet.
Full_Rule_Text: After you explore a planet, ready that planet.

Component_ID: At the start of a combat round, you may exhaust this card to apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a combat round, you may exhaust this card to apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.

Component_ID: Your mechs in this system roll 1 additional die during combat.
Full_Rule_Text: Your mechs in this system roll 1 additional die during combat.

Component_ID: If this unit is in the space area of the active system at the start of a space combat, flip this card.
Full_Rule_Text: If this unit is in the space area of the active system at the start of a space combat, flip this card.

Component_ID: This card begins the game with this side faceup.
Full_Rule_Text: This card begins the game with this side faceup.

Component_ID: If this unit is in the space area of the active system, it is a also ship. At the end of a space battle in the active system, flip this card.
Full_Rule_Text: If this unit is in the space area of the active system, it is a also ship. At the end of a space battle in the active system, flip this card.

Component_ID: This card begins the game with this side facedown.
Full_Rule_Text: This card begins the game with this side facedown.

Component_ID: At the end of a player's turn
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of a player's turn:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to allow that player to explore 1 of their planets.

Component_ID: After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player
Full_Rule_Text: After you gain control of a planet that was controlled by another player:

ACTION: Gain 1 relic and perform the secondary ability of up to 2 readied or unchosen strategy cards; during this action, spend command tokens from your reinforcements instead of your strategy pool. Then, purge this card.

Component_ID: When you have 4 mechs in the same system, you may return 3 of those mechs to your reinforcements to flip this card and place it on top of your mech card.
Full_Rule_Text: When you have 4 mechs in the same system, you may return 3 of those mechs to your reinforcements to flip this card and place it on top of your mech card.

Component_ID: This unit is both a ship and ground force. It cannot be assigned hits from unit abilities. Repair it at the start of every combat round. Game effects cannot place or produce your mechs. When this unit is destroyed or removed, flip this card and return it to your play area.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit is both a ship and ground force. It cannot be assigned hits from unit abilities. Repair it at the start of every combat round. Game effects cannot place or produce your mechs. When this unit is destroyed or removed, flip this card and return it to your play area.

STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES:
Dacxive Animators (G)
Valefar Assimilator X
Valefar Assimilator Y

Component_ID: You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed, you may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.
Full_Rule_Text: You cannot vote on agendas. Once per agenda phase, after an agenda is revealed, you may predict aloud the outcome of that agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 technology that is owned by a player who voted how you predicted.

Component_ID: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.
Full_Rule_Text: Once per combat, after 1 of your opponent's units is destroyed, you may gain 1 technology that is owned by that player.

Component_ID: You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.
Full_Rule_Text: You cannot research technology. When you would research a technology, gain 3 command tokens instead.

Component_ID: At the start of a combat
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a combat:

Component_ID: Place this card faceup in your play area. While this card is in your play area, the Nekro player cannot use his Technological Singularity faction ability against you.
Full_Rule_Text: Place this card faceup in your play area. While this card is in your play area, the Nekro player cannot use his Technological Singularity faction ability against you.

Component_ID: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Nekro player's units, return this card to the Nekro player.
Full_Rule_Text: If you activate a system that contains 1 or more of the Nekro player's units, return this card to the Nekro player.

Component_ID: During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents.
Full_Rule_Text: During setup, take the 2 additional Nomad faction agents and place them next to your faction sheet; you have 3 agents.

Component_ID: During the agenda phase, after an outcome you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good.
Full_Rule_Text: During the agenda phase, after an outcome you voted for or predicted is resolved, gain 1 trade good.

Component_ID: At the start of a space combat against a player other than the Nomad
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a space combat against a player other than the Nomad:

Component_ID: During this combat, treat 1 of your non-fighter ships as if it has the Sustain Damage ability, combat value, and ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE value of the Nomad's flagship.
Full_Rule_Text: During this combat, treat 1 of your non-fighter ships as if it has the Sustain Damage ability, combat value, and ANTI-FIGHTER BARRAGE value of the Nomad's flagship.

Component_ID: Return this card to the Nomad player at the end of the combat.
Full_Rule_Text: Return this card to the Nomad player at the end of the combat.

Component_ID: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.
Full_Rule_Text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

Component_ID: At the start of an invasion combat
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of an invasion combat:

Component_ID: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat. If your opponent is the N'orr player, apply -1 to the result of each of his unit's combat rolls during this combat.
Full_Rule_Text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat. If your opponent is the N'orr player, apply -1 to the result of each of his unit's combat rolls during this combat.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the N'orr player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the N'orr player.

Component_ID: This unit cannot be destroyed by Direct Hit action cards. After a round of space combat, you may destroy this unit to destroy up to 2 ships in this system.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit cannot be destroyed by Direct Hit action cards. After a round of space combat, you may destroy this unit to destroy up to 2 ships in this system.

Component_ID: After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat, if your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.
Full_Rule_Text: After making combat rolls during a round of ground combat, if your opponent produced 1 or more hits, you produce 1 additional hit.

Component_ID: Apply +1 to the result of each of your other ship's combat rolls in this system.
Full_Rule_Text: Apply +1 to the result of each of your other ship's combat rolls in this system.

Component_ID: After this unit uses its Sustain Damage ability during ground combat, it produces 1 hit against your opponent's ground forces on this planet.
Full_Rule_Text: After this unit uses its Sustain Damage ability during ground combat, it produces 1 hit against your opponent's ground forces on this planet.

Component_ID: At the end of a player's tactical ACTION
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of a player's tactical ACTION:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place 2 infantry from their reinforcements on a planet they control in the active system.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card; if you do, that player may place 2 infantry from their reinforcements on a planet they control in the active system.
Unlock: Control 5 planets in non-home systems.

Component_ID: During the Commit Ground Forces step
Full_Rule_Text: During the Commit Ground Forces step:

Component_ID: You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.
Full_Rule_Text: You can commit up to 1 ground force from each planet in the active system and each planet in adjacent systems that do not contain 1 of your command tokens.

Component_ID: After you move ships into the active system
Full_Rule_Text: After you move ships into the active system:

Component_ID: You may skip directly to the Commit Ground Forces step. If you do, after you commit ground forces to land on planets, purge this card and return each of your ships in the active system to your reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: You may skip directly to the Commit Ground Forces step. If you do, after you commit ground forces to land on planets, purge this card and return each of your ships in the active system to your reinforcements.

Component_ID: After you win a combat, either gain 1 command token or research a unit upgrade technology.
Full_Rule_Text: After you win a combat, either gain 1 command token or research a unit upgrade technology.

Component_ID: After you explore a planet that does not have a sleeper token, you may place or move 1 sleeper token onto that planet.
Full_Rule_Text: After you explore a planet that does not have a sleeper token, you may place or move 1 sleeper token onto that planet.

Component_ID: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your sleeper tokens, you may replace each of those tokens with 1 PDS from your reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your sleeper tokens, you may replace each of those tokens with 1 PDS from your reinforcements.

Component_ID: If your flagship or your Awaken faction ability places units into the same space area or onto the same planet as another player's units, your units must participate in combat during the Space Combat or Ground Combat steps.
Full_Rule_Text: If your flagship or your Awaken faction ability places units into the same space area or onto the same planet as another player's units, your units must participate in combat during the Space Combat or Ground Combat steps.

Component_ID: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported. You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported. You may use this unit's SPACE CANNON against ships that are adjacent to this unit's system.

Component_ID: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit is treated as both a structure and a ground force. It cannot be transported.
DEPLOY: After you activate a system that contains 1 or more of your PDS, you may replace 1 of those PDS with this unit.
DEPLOY: When you would place a PDS on a planet, you may place 1 mech and 1 infantry on that planet instead.

Component_ID: When a hit is produced against a unit
Full_Rule_Text: When a hit is produced against a unit:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to cancel that hit.
Unlock: Have 5 structures on the game board.

Component_ID: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION
Full_Rule_Text: When 1 or more of your units use PRODUCTION:
ACTION: Ready Elysium and attach this card to it. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 3, and it gains the SPACE CANNON 5 (x3) ability as if it were a unit.

ACTION: Attach this card to a non-home planet you control other than Mecatol Rex. Its resource and influence values are each increased by 1, and it is treated as having all 3 planet traits (cultural, hazardous, and industrial).

Component_ID: When COALESCENCE results in a ground combat, if you commit no other units, you may choose for your units to coexist instead. During the status phase, for each player you are coexisting with, you and that player each draw 1 additional action card.
Full_Rule_Text: When COALESCENCE results in a ground combat, if you commit no other units, you may choose for your units to coexist instead. During the status phase, for each player you are coexisting with, you and that player each draw 1 additional action card.

Component_ID: Other players may allow you to place a sleeper token on a planet they control.
Full_Rule_Text: Other players may allow you to place a sleeper token on a planet they control.

STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES:
Neural Motivator (0)
Antimass Deflector (0)
Sarween Tools (0)
Plasma Scoring (0)

Component_ID: Apply -1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.
Full_Rule_Text: Apply -1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls.

Component_ID: When you spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the Technology strategy card, you may resolve the primary ability instead.
Full_Rule_Text: When you spend a command token to resolve the secondary ability of the Technology strategy card, you may resolve the primary ability instead.

Component_ID: When you research a technology that is not a unit upgrade technology, you may ignore 1 prerequisite.
Full_Rule_Text: When you research a technology that is not a unit upgrade technology, you may ignore 1 prerequisite.

Component_ID: After the Jol-Nar player researches a technology that is not a faction technology
Full_Rule_Text: After the Jol-Nar player researches a technology that is not a faction technology:

Component_ID: Gain that technology. Then, return this card to the Jol-Nar player.
Full_Rule_Text: Gain that technology. Then, return this card to the Jol-Nar player.

Component_ID: Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.
Full_Rule_Text: Capture your opponent's non-structure units that are destroyed during combat.

Component_ID: When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.
Full_Rule_Text: When you produce a unit, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to produce that unit without spending resources.

Component_ID: When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.
Full_Rule_Text: When you research a unit upgrade technology, you may return 1 captured unit of that type to ignore all of that technology's prerequisites.

Component_ID: This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Place a dimensional tear token beneath this unit as a reminder.
Full_Rule_Text: This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Place a dimensional tear token beneath this unit as a reminder.

Component_ID: Up to 12 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.
Full_Rule_Text: Up to 12 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose another player's non-structure unit in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your space docks. Capture 1 unit of that type from that player's reinforcements.

Component_ID: This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Place a dimensional tear token beneath this unit as a reminder.
Full_Rule_Text: This system is a gravity rift; your ships do not roll for this gravity rift. Place a dimensional tear token beneath this unit as a reminder.

Component_ID: Up to 6 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.
Full_Rule_Text: Up to 6 fighters in this system do not count against your ships' capacity.

Component_ID: Capture all other non-structure units that are destroyed in this system, including your own.
Full_Rule_Text: Capture all other non-structure units that are destroyed in this system, including your own.

Component_ID: When your infantry on this planet are destroyed, place them on your faction sheet; those units are captured.
Full_Rule_Text: When your infantry on this planet are destroyed, place them on your faction sheet; those units are captured.

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to convert their commodities to trade goods and capture 1 unit from their reinforcements that has a cost equal to or lower than their commodity value.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to convert their commodities to trade goods and capture 1 unit from their reinforcements that has a cost equal to or lower than their commodity value.
Unlock: Have units in 3 gravity rifts.

Component_ID: When you produce fighter or infantry units
Full_Rule_Text: When you produce fighter or infantry units:

Component_ID: Up to 2 of those units do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.
Full_Rule_Text: Up to 2 of those units do not count against your PRODUCTION limit.

ACTION: Each other player rolls a die for each of his non-fighter ships that are in or adjacent to a system that contains a dimensional tear; on a 1-3, capture that unit. If this causes a player's ground forces or fighter to be removed, also capture those units.Then, purge this card.

Component_ID: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts during this movement; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead. Then, return this card to the Vuil'raith player.
Full_Rule_Text: Your ships do not roll for gravity rifts during this movement; apply an additional +1 to the move values of your ships that would move out of or through a gravity rift instead. Then, return this card to the Vuil'raith player.

Component_ID: This breakthrough causes The Fracture to enter play without a roll, if it is not already in play. After this card enters play, move up to 2 ingress tokens into systems that contain gravity rifts.
Full_Rule_Text: This breakthrough causes The Fracture to enter play without a roll, if it is not already in play. After this card enters play, move up to 2 ingress tokens into systems that contain gravity rifts.

Component_ID: Apply +1 to the MOVE value of each of your ships that start their movement in The Fracture.
Full_Rule_Text: Apply +1 to the MOVE value of each of your ships that start their movement in The Fracture.

STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES: Choose any 1 technology that has no prerequisites

Component_ID: You do not have to spend influence to remove the custodians token from Mecatol Rex.
Full_Rule_Text: You do not have to spend influence to remove the custodians token from Mecatol Rex.

Component_ID: After you resolve a tactical action during which you gained control of Mecatol Rex, you may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.
Full_Rule_Text: After you resolve a tactical action during which you gained control of Mecatol Rex, you may place 1 PDS and 1 space dock from your reinforcements on Mecatol Rex.

Component_ID: When the Winnu player resolves a strategic ACTION
Full_Rule_Text: When the Winnu player resolves a strategic ACTION:

Component_ID: You do not have to spend or place a command token to resolve the secondary ability of that strategy card.
Full_Rule_Text: You do not have to spend or place a command token to resolve the secondary ability of that strategy card.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Winnu player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Winnu player.

Component_ID: After you resolve the primary or secondary ability of the Diplomacy strategy card, you may gain control of 1 planet other than Mecatol Rex that does not contain any units and is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control.
Full_Rule_Text: After you resolve the primary or secondary ability of the Diplomacy strategy card, you may gain control of 1 planet other than Mecatol Rex that does not contain any units and is in a system that is adjacent to a planet you control.

Component_ID: When an agenda is revealed, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.
Full_Rule_Text: When an agenda is revealed, you may spend 1 token from your strategy pool to discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

Component_ID: Remove 1 token from the Xxcha player's strategy pool and return it to his reinforcements. Then, discard the revealed agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.
Full_Rule_Text: Remove 1 token from the Xxcha player's strategy pool and return it to his reinforcements. Then, discard the revealed agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Xxcha player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Xxcha player.

Component_ID: At the start of a ground combat, you may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a ground combat, you may spend 2 influence to replace 1 of your opponent's participating infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

Component_ID: After each space battle round, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.
Full_Rule_Text: After each space battle round, you may destroy 1 of your cruisers or destroyers in the active system to produce 1 hit and assign it to 1 of your opponent's ships in that system.

Component_ID: At the start of a ground combat against 2 or more ground forces that are not controlled by the Yin player
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a ground combat against 2 or more ground forces that are not controlled by the Yin player:

Component_ID: Replace 1 of your opponent's infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: Replace 1 of your opponent's infantry with 1 infantry from your reinforcements.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Yin player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Yin player.
ACTION: Discard 1 action card from your hand.

Component_ID: When you draw 1 or more action cards, draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.
Full_Rule_Text: When you draw 1 or more action cards, draw 1 additional action card. Then, choose and discard 1 action card from your hand.

Component_ID: You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.
Full_Rule_Text: You can have any number of action cards in your hand. Game effects cannot prevent you from using this ability.

Component_ID: At the start of your turn
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of your turn:

Component_ID: Look at the Yssaril player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.
Full_Rule_Text: Look at the Yssaril player's hand of action cards. Choose 1 of those cards and add it to your hand.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Yssaril player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Yssaril player.

HOME_SYSTEM:
Ordinian: 0/0 (Legendary)
Revelation: 1/2 (Trade Station)
Ordinian Legendary ability: You may exhaust this card when you pass to draw 1 action card and gain 1 command token.
STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES: Choose one blue or yellow technology with no prerequisites.

Component_ID: When you gain control of a planet, ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.
Full_Rule_Text: When you gain control of a planet, ready that planet if it contains a number of your infantry equal to or greater than that planet's resource value; otherwise, place 1 infantry on that planet.

Component_ID: When a game effect instructs a player to galvanize a unit, they place a galvanize token beneath it if it does not have one. Galvanized units roll 1 additional die for combat rolls and unit abilities.
Full_Rule_Text: When a game effect instructs a player to galvanize a unit, they place a galvanize token beneath it if it does not have one. Galvanized units roll 1 additional die for combat rolls and unit abilities.

Component_ID: At the end of a combat, you may galvanize 1 of your units that participated.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of a combat, you may galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

Component_ID: The resource value of this planet is increased by 2
Full_Rule_Text: The resource value of this planet is increased by 2

Component_ID: Cancel 1 hit produced by BOMBARDMENT rolls made against your ground forces for each of your galvanized units present.
Full_Rule_Text: Cancel 1 hit produced by BOMBARDMENT rolls made against your ground forces for each of your galvanized units present.

Component_ID: At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve BOMBARDMENT 8
Full_Rule_Text: At the start of a round of ground combat, you may resolve BOMBARDMENT 8 (X3) against your opponent's ground forces; if you do, make an identical roll against your own ground forces.

Component_ID: The resource value of this planet is increased by 1
Full_Rule_Text: The resource value of this planet is increased by 1

Component_ID: Apply +1 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls for each non-home system that contains a planet you control.
Full_Rule_Text: Apply +1 to the result of each of this unit's combat rolls for each non-home system that contains a planet you control.

Component_ID: When this unit is destroyed, if it was galvanized, galvanize up to 3 of your infantry in its system
Full_Rule_Text: When this unit is destroyed, if it was galvanized, galvanize up to 3 of your infantry in its system

Component_ID: When a player's unit is destroyed
Full_Rule_Text: When a player's unit is destroyed:

Component_ID: You may exhaust this card to galvanize another of that player's units in the destroyed unit's system.
Full_Rule_Text: You may exhaust this card to galvanize another of that player's units in the destroyed unit's system.
Unlock: There are 3 galvanized units on the game board

Component_ID: Your action cards cannot be canceled by Sabotage action cards.
Full_Rule_Text: Your action cards cannot be canceled by Sabotage action cards.

Component_ID: The Nekro Virus cannot place assimilator tokens on your components.
Full_Rule_Text: The Nekro Virus cannot place assimilator tokens on your components.

Component_ID: When one of your galvanized units is destroyed
Full_Rule_Text: When one of your galvanized units is destroyed: You may purge this card to roll 1 die for each unit in its system that belongs to another player; if the result is equal to or greater than the galvanized unit's combat value, destroy that unit.

Component_ID: At the end of a combat
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of a combat:

Component_ID: Galvanize 1 of your units that participated.
Full_Rule_Text: Galvanize 1 of your units that participated.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Last Bastion player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Last Bastion player.

Component_ID: When you produce ships, you may exhaust this card to place those ships in a system that contains 1 of your command tokens, at least 1 of your ground forces, and no other player's ships.
Full_Rule_Text: When you produce ships, you may exhaust this card to place those ships in a system that contains 1 of your command tokens, at least 1 of your ground forces, and no other player's ships.

HOME_SYSTEM:
Mez Lo Orz Fei Zsha : 2/1
Rep Lo Orz Oet : 1/3
STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES: Choose one red or green technology with no prerequisites

Component_ID: After another player activates a system that contains your ships, you may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens
Full_Rule_Text: After another player activates a system that contains your ships, you may move up to 2 of your ships into the active system from adjacent systems that do not contain your command tokens

Component_ID: Your structures can be transported by any ship; this does not require or count against capacity. While your structures are in the space area, they cannot use their unit abilities. At the end of your tactical actions, you may place your structures that are in space areas onto planets you control in their respective systems.
Full_Rule_Text: Your structures can be transported by any ship; this does not require or count against capacity. While your structures are in the space area, they cannot use their unit abilities. At the end of your tactical actions, you may place your structures that are in space areas onto planets you control in their respective systems.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to place 1 PDS on a planet you control.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to repair all of your damaged units.
ACTION: Exhaust this card and discard 1 action card to draw 1 action card.

Component_ID: This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each linkship can trigger the same structure.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each linkship can trigger the same structure.

Component_ID: This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each structure can only be triggered once.
Full_Rule_Text: This unit can use the SPACE CANNON ability of one of your structures in its space area; each structure can only be triggered once.

Component_ID: When this unit retreats, you may destroy 1 ship in the active system that does not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE.
Full_Rule_Text: When this unit retreats, you may destroy 1 ship in the active system that does not have SUSTAIN DAMAGE.

Component_ID: At the end of a round of combat on this planet, you may move up to 2 of your ground forces to this planet from planets in adjacent systems.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of a round of combat on this planet, you may move up to 2 of your ground forces to this planet from planets in adjacent systems.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to draw 2 action cards; give 1 of those cards to another player.
Unlock: Be the last player to pass during the action phase

Component_ID: Immediately retreat up to 2 of your ships from the active system to an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. Place a command token from your reinforcements into that system.
Full_Rule_Text: Immediately retreat up to 2 of your ships from the active system to an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships. Place a command token from your reinforcements into that system.
After the last player passes: You may choose to no longer be passed; if you do, gain 2 command tokens, draw 1 action card, and purge this card.

Component_ID: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command
Full_Rule_Text: You may move your structures from adjacent systems that do not contain your command

Component_ID: tokens onto planets you control in the active system.
Full_Rule_Text: tokens onto planets you control in the active system.

Component_ID: Then, return this card to the Ral Nel player.
Full_Rule_Text: Then, return this card to the Ral Nel player.

Component_ID: During the action phase, if you have not passed, when other players would discard action cards, they are placed on this card instead When you pass, take 1 action card from this card and discard the rest.
Full_Rule_Text: During the action phase, if you have not passed, when other players would discard action cards, they are placed on this card instead When you pass, take 1 action card from this card and discard the rest.

STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES: Choose one blue or red technology with no prerequisites

Component_ID: You cannot use wormholes other than epsilon wormholes. Other players' units that move or are placed into your home system are destroyed.
Full_Rule_Text: You cannot use wormholes other than epsilon wormholes. Other players' units that move or are placed into your home system are destroyed.

Component_ID: When you activate a system that contains a breach, you may flip that breach; systems that contain active breaches are adjacent. At the end of the status phase, any player with ships in a system that contains an active breach may remove that breach.
Full_Rule_Text: When you activate a system that contains a breach, you may flip that breach; systems that contain active breaches are adjacent. At the end of the status phase, any player with ships in a system that contains an active breach may remove that breach.

Component_ID: When you create the game board, place the Sorrow
Full_Rule_Text: When you create the game board, place the Sorrow (tile 94) where your home system would be placed, and place a inactive breach in it. The Sorrow is not a home system. Then, place your home system (tile 118) in your play area.

Component_ID: At the end of any player's combat in this unit's system or up to 2 systems away, you may place 1 active or inactive breach in that system.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of any player's combat in this unit's system or up to 2 systems away, you may place 1 active or inactive breach in that system.

Component_ID: When one of your ships is destroyed, you may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.
Full_Rule_Text: When one of your ships is destroyed, you may produce a ship of the same type at a space dock in your home system.

Component_ID: While this unit is in a system that contains an active breach, other players units in systems with active breaches lose all their unit abilities
Full_Rule_Text: While this unit is in a system that contains an active breach, other players units in systems with active breaches lose all their unit abilities
DEPLOY: During the Commit Ground Forces step of your tactical action in a system that contains an active breach, you may commit 1 mech, even if you have no units in the system.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to choose 1 player. That player may swap the position of 2 of their ships in any systems; they may transport units when they swap.
Unlock: Place a breach token in a system that contains another player's unit.

Component_ID: At the end of a combat between any players
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of a combat between any players: Gain 1 commodity or convert 1 of your commodities to a trade good.
When you produce ships: You may place any of those ships onto this card. At the start of a space combat, you may purge this card to place all ships from this card into the active system.
ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and place the sever token in a system that contains your units; wormholes in that system have no effect during movement.

Component_ID: Remove the sever token and return this card to the Rebellion player at the end of the status phase.
Full_Rule_Text: Remove the sever token and return this card to the Rebellion player at the end of the status phase.

Component_ID: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains an active breach.
Full_Rule_Text: During your tactical actions, apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships that starts its movement in your home system or in a system that contains an active breach.
ACTION: Exhaust this card to flip any breach or place an active breach in a non-home system that contains your units.

Component_ID: When ground forces are committed, if your units on that planet are not already coexisting,
Full_Rule_Text: When ground forces are committed, if your units on that planet are not already coexisting,

Component_ID: you may choose for your units to coexist.
Full_Rule_Text: you may choose for your units to coexist.

Component_ID: When your units begin coexisting on a planet, gain an ocean card and ready it. Any time you have more ocean cards than there are planets that contain your coexisting units, discard ocean cards until you do not.
Full_Rule_Text: When your units begin coexisting on a planet, gain an ocean card and ready it. Any time you have more ocean cards than there are planets that contain your coexisting units, discard ocean cards until you do not.
ACTION: Place this card faceup in your play area and gain 1 non-faction, non-unit upgrade technology that the Deepwrought player owns; place that technology on this card.

Component_ID: Return that technology to the deck and this card to the Deepwrought player at the end of the status phase.
Full_Rule_Text: Return that technology to the deck and this card to the Deepwrought player at the end of the status phase.

HOME_SYSTEM:
Cronos: 2/1
Tallin: 1/2

Cronos Hollow: 3/0
Tallin Hollow: 3/0
STARTING_TECHNOLOGIES: Choose one green or yellow technology that has no prerequisites

Component_ID: You can score secret objectives already scored by other players if you fulfill their requirements; this does not count against your secret objective limit or the number you can score in a round. When you score another player's secret objective, do not gain a victory point; instead, place a facedown plot card into your play area with that player's control token on it.
Full_Rule_Text: You can score secret objectives already scored by other players if you fulfill their requirements; this does not count against your secret objective limit or the number you can score in a round. When you score another player's secret objective, do not gain a victory point; instead, place a facedown plot card into your play area with that player's control token on it.

Component_ID: If you have at least 1 plot card in your play area, gain the following ability
Full_Rule_Text: If you have at least 1 plot card in your play area, gain the following ability:
ACTION: Purge The Firmament's faction sheet, leaders, planet cards, and promissory note. Then, gain all of the faction components for The Obsidian.

Component_ID: This faction cannot be chosen during setup.
Full_Rule_Text: This faction cannot be chosen during setup.

Component_ID: When this faction comes into play, flip your home system, double-sided faction components, and all of your in-play plot cards. Then, ready Cronos Hollow and Tallin Hollow if you control them.
Full_Rule_Text: When this faction comes into play, flip your home system, double-sided faction components, and all of your in-play plot cards. Then, ready Cronos Hollow and Tallin Hollow if you control them.

Component_ID: The player or players whose control tokens are on each plot card are the puppeted players for that plot.
Full_Rule_Text: The player or players whose control tokens are on each plot card are the puppeted players for that plot.

Component_ID: When you receive this card, if you are not the Firmament
Full_Rule_Text: When you receive this card, if you are not the Firmament:

Component_ID: The Firmament player may place 1 facedown plot card in their play area with your control token on it. Then, gain 2 command tokens, gain 2 trade goods, and purge this card.
Full_Rule_Text: The Firmament player may place 1 facedown plot card in their play area with your control token on it. Then, gain 2 command tokens, gain 2 trade goods, and purge this card.

Component_ID: At the end of one of your tactical actions
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of one of your tactical actions:

Component_ID: Spend 1 influence to give this card to one of your neighbors; you can use this ability even if you are the Obsidian player.
Full_Rule_Text: Spend 1 influence to give this card to one of your neighbors; you can use this ability even if you are the Obsidian player.

Component_ID: At the end of the status phase, if you are not the Obsidian player, remove 1 command token from your fleet pool and return it to your reinforcements.
Full_Rule_Text: At the end of the status phase, if you are not the Obsidian player, remove 1 command token from your fleet pool and return it to your reinforcements.
